National Renewable Portfolio Standard (RPS)for Renewable Energy Credits (RECs)? (UtiliPoint.com - Apr. 30, 2007) 



UtiliPoint.com - Apr. 30, 2007 - As an international renewable energy developer utilizing certified emission reductions (CERs) that mandate specific procedures under Clean Development Mechanism (CDM) of the Kyoto Protocol, we find the system for Renewable Energy Credits (RECs) in the United States lacking a single national standard.

NATIONAL NEWS






DTE's 1st-quarter earnings due May 2



Apr. 30--DTE Energy said it will host its annual shareholders meeting May 3 at the company's headquarters in Detroit.  It will announce its first-quarter earnings figure May 2, after the market closes. DTE is the parent company of Detroit Edison, which has 2.2 million customers in southeast Michigan. The state's largest power company is also the parent company of Michigan Consolidated Gas Co., ...


Apr 30, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Gas bills up again



May 1--The good news is, you probably spent less to stay warm during the winter of 2006-07.  The bad news is, the lower gas prices that saved you money are going up. National Fuel Gas Distribution Corp. has announced a 4.3 percent gas-price increase that takes effect today, bumping the bill of a typical resident, who uses 120,000 cubic feet a year, from $113.49 a month to $118.30.


May 1, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Wind power



May 1--PINE BLUFFS -- Business in Pine Bluffs is booming thanks to the construction of a 274-turbine wind farm south of the eastern Laramie County town.  Restaurants in town are packed in the evenings, an auto parts dealer has seen a boost in business, and every rental property in the town of Pine Bluffs is rented. "They have used all the local resources possible to meet their needs, and we ...

Ameren says everything is on the table in talks except for rate freeze and rollbacks



May 1--ORLANDO -- Ameren Corp. says everything but a price freeze and rollback are on the table as the electric rate crisis in Illinois comes down to the wire. Speaking at an industry conference in Orlando on Monday, Ameren's top executives said they are engaged in wide-ranging and intensive discussions with lawmakers who are faced with addressing the state's sky-high electricity prices before ...


May 1, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



HRT bus spills 100 gallons of diesel fuel: About 35 gallons of gas leaked into storm drains after a road work sign in the street damaged the fuel tank.



May 1--HAMPTON -- Nearly all of the 100 gallons of diesel fuel that spilled from the ruptured gas tank of a Hampton Roads Transit bus Monday morning was cleaned up by the afternoon.  Crews from Hampton's fire department and an environmental waste company managed to contain most of the fuel in a vacuum truck and prevented it from flowing into local waterways and water tanks.

Kentucky American seeks 29% rate rise: RESIDENTIAL BILLS WOULD GO UP $5.81



May 1--Kentucky American Water asked for a rate increase yesterday that would boost most residential customers' water bills by 29 percent.  The company filed the rate request with the Kentucky Public Service Commission, which must approve such rate changes. The PSC historically has granted Kentucky American about 50 to 60 percent of what it requests. Kentucky American says the higher rate would ...

Nuclear power should be last resort: Flannery



Climate change scientist and Australian of the Year Tim Flannery says nuclear power should only be a last resort for tackling global warming. The Federal Government is planning to lift bans on nuclear power and remove impediments to uranium mining and exports. Dr Flannery has been a long-time critic of the Federal Government's climate change policies. He says there are many undesirable attributes ...

PepsiCo going all renewable energy



PURCHASE, N.Y., April 30 (UPI) --  PepsiCo announced the largest purchase of renewable energy certificates ever Monday, matching electricity used by all U.S. company facilities. PepsiCo's reported three-year purchase includes more than 1 billion kilowatt-hours annually, the estimated amount of electricity needed power nearly 90,000 U.S. homes each year.
